An immutable Javascript data ledger

Build offline-first web apps, that plug into your exisiting cloud solutions.

Get Started

Serverless & Offline-First; Connectivity as an enhancement.

Server actions are considered an add-on for a Concords app. The library functions completely offline and in the browser.

Merkle-Tree; A cryptographically secured data ledger

As seen in Git and Blockchain implementations, Concords uses a cryptographically secured Merkle Tree to provide integrity in an immutable data ledger.

Decentralized; User owned data, by default.

Using an immutable document structure makes Concords decentralized by default. It's not necessary to pass data through a complex cloud infrastructure.
